description: This course provides a basic introduction to wireless networking and mobile computing. The focus is on layers 2 and 3 of the OSI reference model, design, performance analysis and protocols. However, the higher level issues of mobile computing and wireless applications are also discussed. The course consists of three parts. Part 1 of the course discusses wireless applications (including mobile messaging services, mobile ebusiness and ecommerce, location based services, and wireless sensor applications) and mobile computing platforms and wireless middleware (wireless application protocol, Voice XML, JME, JQuery Mobile, and others). Part 2 of the course concentrates on the wireless networks. The topics covered include: an introduction to wireless networking, antennas, physical wireless communications, digital cellular, wireless LANs, wireless PANs, wireless ATM, mobile IP, satellites, wireless local loops, and wireless sensor networks. The course concludes with discussion of next generation networks, wireless security, wireless integration and wireless network management.
name: WIRELESS NETWORKING
